Package ScrapDataToCsvStorage

Class ControlDatabaseManager

java.lang.Object
ScrapDataToCsvStorage.ControlDatabaseManager
public class ControlDatabaseManager extends Object
Manages interactions with a control database, providing methods to query and update various tables.

  • Constructor Details

    • ControlDatabaseManager

      public ControlDatabaseManager(String databaseName) throws SQLException
      Constructs a ControlDatabaseManager instance and establishes a connection to the specified database. This constructor initializes the connection field using the provided database name.
      Parameters:
      databaseName - The name of the database to connect to.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs or the connection attempt fails.

      Returns:

      Throws:

    • insertDataCheckpoint

      public void insertDataCheckpoint(String groupName, String name, String code, Timestamp dataUptoDate, String note, Timestamp createdAt, Integer createdBy, Integer updatedBy) throws SQLException
      Inserts a new checkpoint record into the data_checkpoints table. This method is used to record significant events or milestones in data processing.
      Parameters:
      groupName - The group name associated with the checkpoint.
      name - The name of the checkpoint.
      code - A unique code to identify the checkpoint.
      dataUptoDate - The timestamp indicating the data coverage of the checkpoint.
      note - Additional notes or details about the checkpoint.
      createdAt - The timestamp when the checkpoint is created.
      createdBy - The ID of the user who created the checkpoint.
      updatedBy - The ID of the user who last updated the checkpoint.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs or the insert operation fails.

    • insertDataFile

      public int insertDataFile(String name, long rowCount, Integer dfConfigId, String status, Timestamp fileTimestamp, Timestamp dataRangeFrom, Timestamp dataRangeTo, String note, Timestamp createdAt, Integer createdBy, Integer updatedBy, Boolean isInserted, Timestamp deletedAt) throws SQLException
      Inserts a new data file record into the data_files table.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the file.
      rowCount - The number of rows in the file.
      dfConfigId - The configuration ID associated with the file.
      status - The status of the file.
      fileTimestamp - The timestamp associated with the file.
      dataRangeFrom - The start range of the data.
      dataRangeTo - The end range of the data.
      note - Additional notes about the file.
      createdAt - The timestamp when the record was created.
      createdBy - The ID of the user who created the record.
      updatedBy - The ID of the user who last updated the record.
      isInserted - Indicates whether the file has been inserted.
      deletedAt - The timestamp when the file was deleted, if applicable.
      Returns:
      The auto-generated ID of the new record.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • insertDataFileConfig

      public int insertDataFileConfig(String name, String code, String description, String sourcePath, String location, String format, String separator, String columns, String destination, Timestamp createdAt, Integer createdBy, Integer updatedBy, String backupPath) throws SQLException
      Inserts a new configuration record into the data_file_configs table.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the configuration.
      code - A unique code for the configuration.
      description - A description of the configuration.
      sourcePath - The source path for the configuration.
      location - The location associated with the configuration.
      format - The format of the data.
      separator - The separator used in the data.
      columns - The columns in the data.
      destination - The destination path for the data.
      createdAt - The timestamp when the configuration was created.
      createdBy - The ID of the user who created the configuration.
      updatedBy - The ID of the user who last updated the configuration.
      backupPath - The backup path for the data.
      Returns:
      The auto-generated ID of the new configuration record.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • updateDataCheckpoint

      public void updateDataCheckpoint(int id, String newGroupName, String newName, String newCode, Timestamp newDataUptoDate, String newNote, Integer newUpdatedBy) throws SQLException
      Updates a data checkpoint record in the data_checkpoints table.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the checkpoint to update.
      newGroupName - The new group name for the checkpoint.
      newName - The new name for the checkpoint.
      newCode - The new code for the checkpoint.
      newDataUptoDate - The new date up to which the data is valid.
      newNote - The new note for the checkpoint.
      newUpdatedBy - The ID of the user who updated the checkpoint.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • updateDataFileConfig

      public void updateDataFileConfig(int id, String newName, String newDescription, String newSourcePath, String newLocation, String newFormat, String newSeparator, String newColumns, String newDestination, Integer newUpdatedBy, String newBackupPath) throws SQLException
      Updates a data file configuration record in the data_file_configs table.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the configuration to update.
      newName - The new name for the configuration.
      newDescription - The new description for the configuration.
      newSourcePath - The new source path for the configuration.
      newLocation - The new location for the configuration.
      newFormat - The new format for the data.
      newSeparator - The new separator used in the data.
      newColumns - The new columns in the data.
      newDestination - The new destination path for the data.
      newUpdatedBy - The ID of the user who updated the configuration.
      newBackupPath - The new backup path for the data.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • updateDataFile

      public void updateDataFile(int id, String newName, Long newRowCount, Integer newDfConfigId, String newStatus, Timestamp updatedAt, Boolean isInserted, String note) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing data file record in the data_files table. This method is typically used to modify details of a data file after its initial creation.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the data file record to update.
      newName - The new name for the data file.
      newRowCount - The updated row count of the data file.
      newDfConfigId - The updated data file configuration ID associated with the file.
      newStatus - The new status of the file (e.g., processed, failed).
      updatedAt - The timestamp of the update.
      isInserted - Indicates whether the file has been successfully inserted into another system or database.
      note - Additional notes or remarks about the file or the update.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs or the update operation fails.

    • deleteDataFile

      public void deleteDataFile(int id) throws SQLException
      Deletes a data file from the data_files table.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the file to delete.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • printResultSet

      public static void printResultSet(ResultSet rs) throws SQLException
      Prints the contents of a ResultSet in a tabular format. This method iterates over the ResultSet and prints each row and column, providing a visual representation of the data.
      Parameters:
      rs - The ResultSet to be printed.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while accessing the ResultSet data.

    • isReadyToRun

      public boolean isReadyToRun() throws SQLException
      Determines if the system is ready to run a new scraping process based on the status of existing processes.
      Returns:
      true if the system is ready to run a new process, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • hasSuccessfulProcessToday

      public boolean hasSuccessfulProcessToday() throws SQLException
      Checks if any scraping process has successfully completed today.
      Returns:
      true if a successful process exists, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • isProcessOngoing

      public boolean isProcessOngoing() throws SQLException
      Checks if any scraping process is currently ongoing and started within the last 30 minutes.
      Returns:
      true if an ongoing process exists, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • hasFailedProcessToday

      public boolean hasFailedProcessToday() throws SQLException
      Checks if any scraping process has failed today.
      Returns:
      true if a failed process exists, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.
